summary: This bill, the Transparency in Security Clearance Denials Act, mandates the Secretary of State to annually report to Congress on adverse security clearance adjudications. The report must include data on denial outcomes, appeals, and success rates, disaggregated by factors like position, ethnicity, gender (when available), and provide a description of the criteria used. The initial report will cover a period starting January 1, 2024. The bill defines terms like 'covered adjudicative outcome,' 'continuous vetting,' and 'periodic reinvestigation'.
